interpolate module¶

Interpolation module of MSE ETC.

This module determines the atmospheric transmission depending on pwv and wavelength. This specifies transmission values affected by various variables using data preprocessed using convolution and interpolation.

Modification Log:

  • 2020.02.25 - First created by Taeeun Kim

  • 2020.03.24 - Updated by Tae-Geun Ji

  • 2020.03.29 - Updated by Tae-Geun Ji

  • 2021.04.21 - Updated by Mingyoeng Yang

  • 2021.04.26 - Updated by Mingyeong Yang

class interpolate.Throughput[source]¶

Bases: object

Determines the atmospheric throughput.

Cal_tau_atmo(wave, transmission1, transmission2, transmission7, pwv)[source]¶

Calculates the atmospheric throughput with parameters.

This function estimates the transmission value corresponding to a specific pwv by calculating transmission data with different pwv.

params:
wave (float): The wavelength band.

  • Blue 360- 560 nm

  • Green 540 - 740 nm

  • Red 715 - 985 nm

  • Nir 960 - x nm

transmission1 (float): The atmospheric transmission extracted under pwv = 1.0. transmission2 (float): The atmospheric transmission extracted under pwv = 2.5. transmission7 (float): The atmospheric transmission extracted under pwv = 7.5. pwv (float): Precipitable Water Vapor.

Returns

The atmospheric transmission.

Return type

y (float)

Raises:

Get_tau_atmo(input_pwv, input_wavelength)[source]¶

Return the result value for input parameters.

This function returns the atmospheric throughput according to the wavelength band and pwv inputed by the user, using the calculation defined in the middle level functions above.

params:

input_pwv (float): pwv set by the user input_wavelength (float): wavelength band set by the user

Returns

The atmospheric transmission

Return type

tau_atmo (float)

Raises:

set_data(res_mode)[source]¶

Sets the data array suitable for each resolution mode.

params:
res_mode (str): The resolution mode.

  • Low resolution

  • Moderate resolution

  • High resolution

Raises:

tau_atmo_blue(pwv)[source]¶

Returns the atmospheric throughput in blue wavelength.

This fuction finds a specific atmospheric throughput suitable for pwv. It uses 1-D inpolation of data array in the blue wavelength band.

params:

pwv (float): Precipitable Water Vapor.

Returns

The atmospheric throughput.

Return type

tau_atmo (float)

tau_atmo_green(pwv)[source]¶

Returns the atmospheric throughput in green wavelength.

tau_atmo_nir(pwv)[source]¶

Returns the atmospheric throughput in nir-infrared wavelength.

tau_atmo_red(pwv)[source]¶

Returns the atmospheric throughput in red wavelength.

tau_ie_res(wave)[source]¶

Returns the injection efficiency.

tau_opt_res(wave)[source]¶

Returns the optical values.
